definition: to disguise oneself as/to dress up/to play (a role)/to put on (an expression)
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: Jimmy swallowed the medicine and made a face.
sentences.chinese: 吉米吞下藥後扮了個苦相。

sentences.english: How comes he does the monsters, I play the girlie ghosts?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼怪物他來扮我就只能裝這些女裏女氣的鬼魂？

sentences.english: The partisan disguised himself as a peddler and got by the enemy sentry box.
sentences.chinese: 游擊隊員扮小販通過敵人的崗亭。

sentences.english: The criminal tried to grasp at a straw by feigning mental disorder.
sentences.chinese: 罪犯裝瘋扮傻，企圖抓住一根救命稻草。

sentences.english: I squeezed her hand. And then grimaced.
sentences.chinese: 我抓緊她的手，然後扮了個鬼臉。

sentences.english: He speaks in a cutesy voice on behalf of the dog.
sentences.chinese: 他尖着嗓子嬌滴滴的扮狗狗說話真是讓我無語了。

sentences.english: The monoamines also play a role in rewiring the brain in response to new experiences.
sentences.chinese: 單胺類在新經驗造成的腦部線路重組上，也扮有一角。

sentences.english: They look like models or actors playing a part.
sentences.chinese: 他們看上去像扮模特或在劇中扮演的一個角色。

sentences.english: At the circus, the clowns mopped and mowed.
sentences.chinese: 馬戲演出時，丑角扮怪相。

sentences.english: No one can be the flash.
I told her to stop being lazy, cowardly, self-indulgent and pathetic.
sentences.chinese: 我告訴她拋開懶惰，懦弱，停止放任自己和扮可憐相。

sentences.english: CAI core and a small man look but eye, deliberately play fans require Monroes signature.
sentences.chinese: 蔡芯和小曼看不過眼，故意扮歌迷要求夢露簽名。

definition: (of a man) to dress as a woman (idiom)
to act cute/putting on adorable airs/to pretend to be lovely
(Chinese opera) to play a role outside of one's specialty/(modern) to play a transvestite role/to masquerade as an opponent
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
to impersonate/to act the part of sb/to disguise oneself as sb else
to play the fool (idiom)/to feign madness

(slang) to act cute

to develop/to evolve/to practice/to perform/to play/to act
clown role in opera/clown/buffoon
to pose (for a picture)
to play stupid/to act like an idiot
to pretend
